uk.ac.aber.dcs.blockmotion.model

Interface IFrame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IFrameClass

    public interface IFrame
    This interface represents a single frame. YOU MUST NOT CHANGE THIS INTERFACE!
    Version:
    1.0, 14th March 2017
    Author:
    Chris Loftus

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IFrame copy()
      Returns a copy of the current frame
      char getChar(int i, int j)
      Gets the character from the given position in the grid

    • Method Detail

      • insertLines

        void insertLines(java.lang.String[] lines)
        Insert the given array of lines into the frame. Must be the same size as the frame; i.e. same number of rows.
        Parameters:
        lines - an array of lines
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if lines size is not the same size of the frame

      • getNumRows

        int getNumRows()
        The number of rows
        Returns:
        the number of rows

      • tofile

        void tofile(java.io.PrintWriter outfile)
        Writes the frame to the given open outfile
        Parameters:
        outfile - the open file to write to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if outfile is null or closed

      • getChar

        char getChar(int i,
             int j)
        Gets the character from the given position in the grid
        Parameters:
        i - the row
        j - the column
        Returns:
        the found character
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i,j do not represent a valid place in the frame

      • setChar

        void setChar(int i,
             int j,
             char ch)
        Sets the character in the given position on the grid
        Parameters:
        i - the row
        j - the column
        ch - the character to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i,j do not represent a valid place in the frame

      • copy

        IFrame copy()
        Returns a copy of the current frame
        Returns:
        the exact copy as a distinct object

      • replace

        void replace(IFrame f)
        Replaces the contents of the currect frame by the provided frame
        Parameters:
        f - the frame to insert
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if f is a different size or null
